learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of essential strategy concepts and processes required to design and evaluate a business strategy delivering value for multiple stakeholders.
Demonstrate an understanding of and apply appropriate strategy concepts and tools to analyse factors affecting an organisations’ internal and external environment.
Work collaboratively to prepare and execute a strategy.
Reflect on the choices and outcomes of strategic decisions, demonstrated structured problem-solving and critical thinking.
Demonstrate understanding of organisational design as foundation to execute a strategy.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Presentation, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description: Materials will be available the day before - 31 July 2025.Format: complete group report (written) and deliver presentation of report, including Q&AFormative: students develop a brief strategic plan for their simulation company to guide their decision-making. Plan won’t be marked separately, but will be part of final audit. Submission: by module 8 (2nd session of students playing the simulation)Peer assessment: assignment involves peer assessment to moderate group marks.Rationale: simulation provide students a WIL experience that lays the foundation for their degree. The focus of the assessment will be on their plan, actions, and recommendations in front of an industry audience.Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task.
